isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING - Clearance, Marker and Tail Lights on Tractors and Trucks With International Engine

svcproc.title: Clearance, Marker and Tail Lights on Tractors and Trucks With International Engine

table.title: Clearance, Marker and Tail Lights on Tractors and Trucks With International Engine

entry.para: Remove fuse F24 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Replace fuse F24 and at circuit 14E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14E, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (35) and at circuit 50A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50A, then repair.
Test headlight switch (35) by moving switch to park light on position and measuring resistance from terminal 4 to 5.
Test headlight switch (35) by moving switch to the headlight on position and measuring resistance from terminal 5 to 6.
Remove relay (R2) and reconnect switch (35). At relay socket (R2), with the headlight sw. in the park or headlight position, measure voltage from circuit 58A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58A, then repair.
Remove fuse F8 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Replace fuse F8 and at circuit 14A, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
At relay socket (R2), measure voltage from circuit 58 to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58, then repair.
Does vehicle have an interrupt switch (32)?
Disconnect conn. (32) and measure resistance from circuit 58-GB to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58-GB or 11-GA/ 11-GF to cab ground, then repair.
Test interrupt switch by measuring resistance from terminal 1 to 2 with switch in lights on position.
Re-install switch (32) and at relay socket (R2), measure voltage from circuit 58 to 58-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58-G, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (202) and measure resistance from white wire, going to cab ground, to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in white wire to ground.
Reconnect conn. (202) and at relay socket (R2), measure voltage from circuit 58 to 58-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58-GA, then repair.
Bench test relay (R2) by applying +12 volts to terminal 86 and ground to terminal 85, while measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
De-energize relay and measure resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Disconnect conn. (2) and re-install relay (R2). With headlight switch in park light position, measure voltage at conn. (2) circuit 58D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 58B or 58D, then repair.
Do left and right front marker lights illuminate?
Connect conn. (2), disconnect conn. (503) and move headlight switch to park light position. At (503) measure voltage from circuit 58E to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58D or 58E, then repair.
At (503) measure voltage from circuit 58E to 11-GD.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GD, (11-GC with US DRL only) 11-GB or 11-GJ, then repair.
Replace defective bulb or socket assembly.
Disconnect conn. (505), and with headlight switch in park position, at (505) measure voltage from circuit 58F to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58F, then repair.
At (505) measure voltage from circuit 58F to 11-GF.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GF, 11-GE, 11-GB, or 11-GJ, then repair.
Replace defective bulb or socket assembly.
If applicable, do left and right front pedestal mounted lights function properly?
Disconnect conn. (511) and move headlight switch to park light position. At (511) measure voltage from circuit 58H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58H, then repair.
At (511) measure voltage from circuit 58H to 11-GG.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GG or 11-GB to cab ground, then repair.
Replace defective bulb or socket assembly
Disconnect conn. (512) and move headlight switch to park light position. At (512) measure voltage from circuit 58J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58J, then repair.
At (512) measure voltage from circuit 58J to 11-GH.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GH or 11-GB to cab ground, then repair.
Replace defective bulb or socket assembly.
Do left and right tail lights function properly?
Disconnect conn. (13) and move headlight switch to park light position. At (13) measure voltage from circuit 68 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68, then repair.
Remove left tail light bulb and move headlight switch to park light position. At socket contact connected to brown wire, measure voltage to ground.
Lt. tail light socket, brown wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
At left tail light socket, measure voltage from contact connected to brown wire to contact connected to white wire.
Lt. tail light socket, brown to white wire.
Locate open or poor connection in white wire to frame ground, then repair.
Remove right tail light bulb and move headlight switch to park light position. At socket contact connected to brown wire, measure voltage to ground.
Rt. tail light socket, brown wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
At right tail light socket, measure voltage from contact connected to brown wire to contact connected to white wire.
Rt. tail light socket, brown to white wire.
Locate open or poor connection in white wire to frame ground, then repair.
Do any of the cab clearance and marker lamps illuminate?
Replace the faulty bulb or socket for the lamp that is out.
Disconnect conn. (19) and move headlight switch to park light position. At (19) measure voltage from circuit 58C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58C, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (15) and reconnect (19). With headlight switch in park light position, at (15) measure voltage from circuit 58C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58C, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (15), remove a lamp and with headlight switch in park light position, measure voltage from the socket center pin to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58C, 58C1, 58C2, 58C3 or 58C4, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (19) and measure resistance from circuit 58-GC to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-G or 58-GC, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (19), disconnect conn. (15) and at (15) measure voltage from circuit 58-GC to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58-GC, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (15), remove a lamp and with headlight switch in park light position, measure voltage from the socket center pin to side of socket.
Socket center pin to side of socket.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 58-GC, 58-GC4, 58-GC3, 58-GC2 or 58-GC1, then repair.
Tractor circuits check good. For trailer wiring, refer to Part 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, and 35.
